list_definition.definition: a device which you turn on and off to control the flow of water from a pipe; tap British

list_ex_of_english: This is normally done at a small faucet or shower located in the same room as the tub, while seated on a small stool.
The flow into the bathtub is water flowing through the faucet while the outflow is water flowing down the drain.
Neurochemical synaptic transmission is often characterized as a random process, but the "dripping faucet" model may be adapted to explain this apparent randomness as a case of deterministic chaos.
The man begins sniffling while cutting onions, and goes to the bathroom to wash his eyes, silently standing while letting the faucet run.
This is a grinding lap, so it is very coarse, and the sound is something like a running faucet.
The model of non-conserved spread can best be represented by a continuously running faucet running through a series of funnels connected by tubes.
The faucet closes its valve again after a few seconds or when it no longer detects the presence of hands.
She tells him to get an apartment and install the faucet there to remind him that he is capable of being a huge phony again.
